net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class Checkbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractButton
        • net.cloud.gfx.elements.SelectableButton
          • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Checkbox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable

    public class Checkbox
extends SelectableButton
    A checkbox is a box which well.. uh.. may be checked. Any number of them may be checked. There is a text label to the right of the checkbox to indicate what it is for.
    As with a normal button, only so many constructor options are available. For wider control, there are setter methods to configure things such as font, priority, and action.

    • Field Detail

      • PRIORITY

        public static final int PRIORITY
        Default priority of a Button. Moderate.

      • actionHandler

        private java.util.Optional<java.util.function.Consumer<Checkbox>> actionHandler
        Called when an action is performed on the button.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checkbox

        public Checkbox(java.lang.String label,
                int x,
                int y)
        Create a new checkbox with default size, image assets, and priority. The default size is 15x15. If you want to resize much bigger than that, it's probably a better idea to use a larger sprite.
        Parameters:
        label - Text label to describe the button
        x - X-location
        y - Y-location

      • Checkbox

        public Checkbox(java.lang.String label,
                int x,
                int y,
                int width,
                int height)
        Create a new checkbox with default image assets, and priority. The provided dimensions are only for the button. If you want to resize much bigger than that, it's probably a better idea to use a larger sprite.
        Parameters:
        label - Text label to describe the button
        x - X-location
        y - Y-location
        width - The width of the checkbox itself - does not include the text
        height - The height of the checkbox itself - does not include the text

      • Checkbox

        public Checkbox(java.lang.String label,
                int x,
                int y,
                int width,
                int height,
                int firstSpriteID)
        Create a new checkbox with the given parameters. The provided dimensions are only for the button. If you want to resize much bigger than that, it's probably a better idea to use a larger sprite. If you want to use a custom sprite, prefer this constructor to avoid extra image work.
        Parameters:
        label - Text label to describe the button
        x - X-location
        y - Y-location
        width - The width of the checkbox itself - does not include the text
        height - The height of the checkbox itself - does not include the text
        firstSpriteID - The sprite ID of the first background image asset

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed()
        Toggles the state of the checkbox, and then informs the action handler if one is present.
        Overrides:
        actionPerformed in class SelectableButton

      • setActionHandler

        public void setActionHandler(java.util.function.Consumer<Checkbox> action)
        Set a new action to this button. When the button is pressed or has an action performed on it, the action's method will be called and supply this button instance. By providing null as a parameter to this method, you may remove the current handler.
        Parameters:
        action - The method to call when action is taken on this button
